rental.headline: STUNNING FAMILY RESIDENCE!
rental.description:
The big picture.
Where to begin to describe this magnificent palatial home that has no comparison to anything on the market. Rarely is a property of this magnitude offered for lease. Located on Canterbury’s Golden Mile, this Tuscan style mansion sits on a massive 2051 sqm block and will offer its lucky resident understated elegance on a grand scale.
The little details.
Entering this home, you are greeted with a sweeping spiral staircase with a soaring circular void. With multiple living zones that provides a perfect environment for the modern family. Over two levels this substantial home offers; formal sitting room, massive games/billiards room (with pool table and all equipment), well-appointed study, sophisticated dining room with a HUGE dining table perfect for entertaining large groups, casual meals & a dream gourmet kitchen equipped with everything that the discernible cook desires including but not limited to; dishwasher, built in fridge (with space for one more in the generous walk in pantry), ample storage, Calcutta marble benchtops.
Alfresco entertaining & recreation is catered for with an outdoor cabana room complete with TV, barbecue & fireplace, sparkling pool with a retractable glass enclosure so it can be used all year round, rear storage, bathroom with separate toilet and shower facilities. North South flood-lit tennis court. You will never need to leave!
The upper level incorporates a relaxing balcony overlooking the stunning front garden & five massive bedrooms including a magnificent master domain that rivals a five-star hotel. With a tranquil mood pond, this majestic home offers light & luxury. Spectacular bathrooms are a plenty, walk in robes to all bedrooms and a fully fitted out master walk in robe that will make your friends and family envious!
The extras.
• Hydronic heating throughout • Ducted air conditioning • Fully automated throughout • Motorised blinds • CCTV & alarm system • Internal access from the double garage (with storage) • Rear enclosed carport for 2 cars with automatic gate • Floorboards to the living areas and carpet to the bedrooms • TVs in all bedrooms and living areas • Speakers in all rooms • Ornate fireplaces
Close to leading private schools, parks, trams, trains & shops, this is the perfect family home for the discerning tenant.

rental.headline: Stunning Family Home
rental.description:
The big picture. This stylish near new family home has everything a discerning occupant could ask for and will provide you ample space for your family.
The little details. With 4 bedrooms, main with ensuite and BIR, and 3 further double bedrooms all with generous BIRs. Modern family bathroom, powder room and gorgeous open plan family and kitchen. The kitchen features gas appliances, dishwasher, ample cupboard and bench space. This home also features a large fitted laundry and a lovely rear garden space perfect for the children to play. A double remote garage with separate driveway give you plenty of space to park and store. With gas ducted heating, two reverse cycle air conditioners and endless supply of hot water, you will be kept comfortable all year round. NBN ready, grey water system for the toilets and a shed in the rear yard completes this property!
The extras. Located in a quiet family area that is within walking distance to Southland Shopping Centre and Cheltenham Secondary College, this property is sure to tick all of your boxes!

rental.headline: STYLISH NEAR NEW FAMILY HOME
rental.description:
The big picture. This stylish near new family home has everything a discerning occupant could ask for and will provide you ample space for your family.
The little details. With 3 bedrooms, main with ensuite and WIR, and two further double bedrooms one with WIR and the other with BIR. Modern family bathroom, powder room and gorgeous open plan family and kitchen. The kitchen features gas appliances, dishwasher, ample cupboard and bench space. This home also features a large fitted laundry and a lovely rear garden space perfect for the children to play. A double remote garage with separate driveway give you plenty of space to park and store. With gas ducted heating, two reverse cycle air conditioners and endless supply of hot water, you will be kept comfortable all year round.
The extras. Located in a quiet family area that is within walking distance to Southland Shopping Centre and Cheltenham Secondary College, this property is sure to tick all of your boxes!

rental.headline: Recently Painted Throughout
rental.description:
The big picture This recently painted property also has newly polished floorboards throughout, with spacious rooms and outdoor space, this home will be sure to tick all of your boxes.
The finer details With 3 large bedrooms all with built in robes, a gas kitchen with ample cupboard and bench space, a large lounge with adjoining dinning area, 2 bathrooms, separate toilet, large laundry & gas heating. Also featuring a single lock up garage, shed and massive rear yard. This property has been recently been painted, and floorboards polished throughout.
The extras
Situated close to Clayton North Primary School, Monash Medical Centre, Princes Hwy and Clayton train station, this 3 bedroom home will not last long.

rental.headline: Award Winning Development
rental.description:
The big picture.
This award winning development offers you a tranquil luscious environment with a massive private terrace perfect for lazy Sundays drinking coffee or cooking up a storm on your barbecue.
The little details.
Featuring an open plan kitchen, lounge and meals area that opens onto a stunning & spacious private terrace, you'll want to have your friends over! With 2 generous bedrooms both with more storage than you can pick a stick at, a main bathroom and ensuite to the master, reverse cycle heating & cooling, floorboards to living areas and carpet to the bedrooms. This apartment features a green tranquil outlook and has security entrance and intercom.
The extras.
Now this is an address that truly lives up to its A-grade position. Located in a highly sought-after pocket of Hawthorn East right in the heart of the Anderson Park precinct. The many delights of Auburn Village and Camberwell Junction are also only a short distance away. What more could you want? Apartments of this quality do not last long so jump in quickly to secure this amazing property.

rental.headline: A Californian Treasure!
rental.description:
The big picture.
Endless sunshine streams through the north-facing façade of this Californian Bungalow, showcasing exquisitely renovated and extended interiors. Like a rare and finely cut diamond, families are guaranteed to be mesmerised by the luxurious designer finishes. Love alfresco entertaining? Just kick back and relax with your friends as the kids laugh and play in the landscaped garden paradise where the spring and autumn colours are simply breathtaking.
The finer details.
Your guests will mingle alongside the shimmering white stone in the brand new connoisseur’s kitchen featuring a white-enamel Smeg oven and Miele dishwasher. While the vast array of living zones combine ornate period flourishes with the latest contemporary enhancements, it’s the separate fifth bedroom with stylish ensuite that will excite families seeking the flexibility of a guest bedroom, studio/retreat or even a home office with separate entry.
The extras.
Cafes, schools, parks and transport – they’re all right at your doorstep. Vibrant Through Road Village and Burwood Village offer fabulous dining and retail choices, while Lynden Park, Through Road Reserve and Cooper Reserve are there for exercise and relaxation. With Wattle Park Primary School just around the corner, walk to two tram routes bound for Strathcona, Siena College, Camberwell High, PLC, Mount Scopus and Deakin University.
• On the high side of a leafy street • Inviting fireplaces in the sunny study and lounge room • Full-height glazing and French doors out to an under-cover alfresco • Kitchen fitted with 2pac soft-close cabinetry • Sparkling bathrooms including a newly renovated fully-tiled porcelain ensuite • Ducted heating and multiple split system air-conditioners • Two-car carport parking • Short drive to Middle Camberwell Shopping Village
This gorgeous property wont be on the market for long so you will need to jump in quickly!

rental.description:

Very generous kitchen with gas cooking, dishwasher, an abundance of storage and bench space, ducted heating and a giant secure rear yard perfect for backyard cricket or for the kids to run around in. Completing this fantastic home is a large double garage.

A short stroll to Anderson Park, Auburn South Primary School & Auburn High School & Bialik College, trams close by, along with Camberwell Junction, Private Schools, and the Monash Freeway this property will be sure to meet all of your wants and needs! Register today in order to inspect the property, this wont last long!

rental.headline: Neat as a Pin!
rental.description:

This home is completed with reverse cycle air-conditioning, hydronic heating throughout and off street parking.
The extras Located within Southland Shopping Centre just a 7-10 minute walk away, childcare, schools and shops also within walking distance. If you cant walk, then don't worry the bus stop is at your front door!

rental.description:

rental.description:
The big picture. Set in a tranquil leafy enclave, this low maintenance stylish townhouse offers all of the advantages of city living in a quiet leafy location.
The finer details. Positioned towards the rear, you will be impressed by the abundance of natural light that flows through the spacious residence. Downstairs features spacious family living room, modern kitchen with ample bench and cupboard space, gas appliances and dishwasher. Second family living and dining room opening onto a generous rear entertaining deck and secure parking with automatic gates. Completing the downstairs living area is a European laundry with plenty of space for your washing machine & dryer and a powder room.
Upstairs you will find 3 light filled bedrooms all with large built in robes, master with direct bathroom access and leafy tree top outlook. Separate powder room and two split systems will keep you comfortable all year round.
With Plantation Shutters throughout, beautiful floorboards downstairs and carpet upstairs you will need to jump in quickly to secure this residence.
The extras. Close to Glenferrie & Malvern Roads, walking distance to Malvern Central and convenient access to Armadale train station, trams and arterials to the CBD this property is sure tick all of your boxes!

rental.description:

The finer details. As soon as you walk into your secure, private and low maintenance north facing courtyard you will be transported. With a generous living and dining room with elegant parquetry flooring opening onto a stunning gas kitchen with Bosch appliances, dishwasher, stone benchtops and ample cupboard space. Both bedrooms are light filled with built in robes. Also featuring a large modern bathroom, separate toilet and a separate European laundry. With secure automatic gates leading to undercover parking for one car, security intercom and additional storage in the front courtyard this apartment definitely wont last very long.
The extras. Located a few minutes drive from the Eastern Freeway & all of the amenities that Kew Junction has to offer, what more could you ask for? Contact us today to arrange an inspection!

rental.description:

This fantastic apartment also has off street parking for your convenience.
The extras. Located at the end of a quiet cul-de-sac right near the beautiful Pridmore Park and easy access to the Yarra River. With the Church Street tram a short stroll away, opening up a whole world of shopping, entertainment and culinary delights! Register today for an inspection, you wont be disappointed!

rental.headline: Architecturally Designed!
rental.description:
The big picture. This architecturally designed townhouse is the perfect residence to isolate yourself in away from the world. With all of the creature comforts you need! Situated over three levels with a north facing aspect, this home has all the features you need to stay at home in comfort and security.
The little details. Featuring 2 bedrooms with built in robes & a third bedroom or study Two bedrooms (built in robes) and study/third bedroom, a large open plan living area that opens to a great sized balcony. The kitchen features plenty of storage & bench space, gas cooking and dishwasher. The modern master bathroom has a seperate bath and shower and ample storage, powder room on the middle level & European laundry on the lower level. Split system AC & heating units in the living areas and two bedrooms will keep you comfortable all year around. Completing this property is a single lock up garage, security intercom and internal alarm system.
The extras. With easy access to the Monash Freeway, public transport (both train and tram), parklands, shopping & schools.

rental.headline: An Urban Delight!
rental.description:
The big picture.
This urban delight located on the 32nd floor of the new SkyOne development is sure to impress! Not like the rest of the apartments in the complex you will have your own skylounge to share with only 8 other residents, not to mention many other amazing communal facilities.
The little details.
Featuring 2 generous bedrooms both with built in robes, open plan gas kitchen with dishwasher and island bench. Lounge opening onto balcony with AMAZING views! Plenty of storage, 2 beautifully appointed bathrooms and laundry facilities complete this apartment. But we can't forget the communal amenities are are second to none. Residents on the 32nd floor (and there are only 8) have exclusive access to their very on sky lounge! A beautiful & luxurious swimming pool and fully equipped library are just some of the advantages of living in this spectacular development.
The extras. Located in the heart of Box HIll, you have every amenities and transport located within a short stroll. Amazing restaurants and cafes, precinct shopping and so much more!

rental.description:
The big picture. This stunning apartment is located above a commercial shop giving you privacy and security. With its high ceilings, period features and ample storage, your search for a new home stops right here.
The finer details. Recently renovated, this apartment features a spacious kitchen with stacks of bench and cupboard space, dishwasher and modern appliances. The high ceilings and large rooms will give you plenty of space to relax and unwind or hide away while in lockdown. Each bedroom has its own split system heating and AC and large cupboards. The bathroom is light & bright and modern. Entrance to the property is via a private rear stairwell, with your car parked securely behind a remote gate.
The extras. With public transport and ample shopping at your doorstep, this property will not be on the list for long!

Also featuring ducted heating and split system heating/cooling, this home ticks all of the boxes!
The extras. Located close to schools, transport and local shopping, this property is a must inspect and will be snapped up quickly.

rental.headline: Charming 4 Bedroom Home
rental.description:
The big picture.
This charming four bedroom family home is exceptionally well located near the Camberwell Junction shopping precinct. Perfect for those wanting to be near the action but not in it. . The quiet tree lined street also boasts easy access to a myriad of sought-after schools (zoned to Auburn South Primary).
The finer details. This well-proportioned home features high ceilings throughout and spacious room. With 4 generous bedrooms with BIRS, study, large lounge with gas heating there is plenty of room to move around. An extremely large kitchen with more bench and cupboard space than you will know what to do with! Gas cooking and dishwasher and large meals area, huge laundry, separate toilet and bathroom. You certainly wont be short on space! The rear family area opens onto an alfresco entertaining area and large lawn. Adjoining the relaxing garden area sits a small tool shed joined to the garage with side-lane access for a single vehicle.
The extras. Take a short walk to cafes, restaurants, bars, cinemas and markets or take the dog for a long walk around Fritsch Holzer Park at the end of the street. If this is not enough….take a short tram ride to the CBD with a stop at the end of the street, or easy motor vehicle access via the nearby CityLink The landlord welcomes pets of all types and sizes and is open to both short term and longer term leases.

rental.headline: Tranquil Delight!
rental.description:
The big picture.
Light, bright and beautiful: this home is a true stunner. From the moment you walk through the front gates, the residence is warm and welcoming. Spacious floorplan allows you to spread out, while large windows in bedrooms and glass doors in the living room keep everything bathed in sunlight. But the best part? A wraparound courtyard perfect for summer parties. Throw open those doors!
The little details.
Fancy a cup of tea? Because the expansive landscaped gardens at both the front and the back of the house are made for a daily wind down in nature. The winding red brick pathway that connects these areas echoes the painted white brick of the residence itself, and a north-west-facing orientation maximises on light. Well, we did say it's a beauty. This property has recently been freshly painted and boards polished throughout. With 3 generous bedrooms, all with large built in robes, the master suite has a private garden outlook, generous proportions and an entire wall of built in robes for ample storage. A light and bright updated kitchen with gas appliances, dishwasher and plenty of bench and cupboard space with meals area. We cant forget to mention the large lounge and formal dining areas that will allow your family the space to comfortably move around. A double lock up garage and ducted heating & split system AC complete this fantastic home.
The extras.
Get ready to feast on the east. While 3 Shaftesbury Avenue already stands in a verdant enclave, it's also only a stroll down the road from the Malvern Public Gardens. The residence is just a short walk from the abundance of boutiques, cafés and restaurants, as well as the tram lines, of Malvern Road and High Street. Tooronga Station is also less than 1km away.
• A-grade position • 2 car garage • Solid brick • Single level throughout • One of only two residences

rental.description:
The big picture. This striking family residence is located in the heart of Melbourne's finest schools. With double glazed windows to the front of the property means you will have the convenience of being located on a main road but without the noise.
The finer details. Situated on a large block with lovely gardens and high fences, this home will tick all of your family's boxes. Generous sized rooms throughout with exquisite period features, recently repainted throughout with near new carpets, a distinctive entrance foyer that will be the talk of all of your friends. Downstairs features 2 large bedrooms with built in robes, stunning renovated bathroom, gorgeous front formal living room with Jetmaster open wood fireplace, separate dining room/study and expansive open plan kitchen, meals and family area opening onto a large entertaining deck and garden for the kids to play in. Kitchen features ample storage and bench space with dishwasher. Moving upstairs you will find another 2 large bedrooms with walk in robes, generous bathroom with separate shower and spa bath. Additional attic storage will give you space to hide a way the things you need but don't want to see! Completing this house is a monitored security alarm (monitoring at tenants cost) and ducted heating and cooling and Rheem infinity hot water system.
The extras. With automatic front gates and a circular driveway, this property is easy to get in and out of. With close proximity to Camberwell/Auburn shopping, transport and of course some of Melbourne's' best schools this property will not last long. Arrange a private inspection before you miss out!

rental.description:

Located in a highly sought-after pocket of Hawthorn East right in the heart of the Anderson Park precinct. a short walk to Burke Road, where it's only a few tram stops to Camberwell Junction. rental.description:

Nestled in a coveted Scotch Hill position, this neat casual home is perfect for relaxed entertaining today, while still offering endless renovating or re-building opportunities for tomorrow (subject to council approval of course).
The little details.
Built by Printz the builder in April 1934 this is the first time this cherished property has been released on the market. Featuring original period details including the beautiful bay windows, kitchen joinery and leadlight windows, it's the perfect foundation for modern touch-ups. Authentic, distinctive and colourful, with a cottage garden garnish, this 725-sqm site is the perfect mix of old and new.
The extras.
A little door where the milkman would leave his delivery every morning is just one the lovely surprises hidden within. Other local (not so secret) highlights include Choi's restaurant, Scotch College and Gardiners Creek Trail for fine food, education and adventures.

residential.headline: A beloved classic – ready for a rewrite
residential.description:
The big picture.
Lovingly held by the one family since 1991, this charming Edwardian features period details, wide hallways, large bedrooms and a pressed metal ceiling, adding layers of character to a winsome classic.
The little details.
This graceful dame offers an exciting renovation opportunity for the adventurous at heart. But with its General Residential zoning, generous 450sqm size and 14.79m frontage, there's endless potential to create something special in Kew (subject to council approval of course).
The extras.
With Kew Junction, Leo's supermarket and some of Melbourne's most popular cafés just a short wander from home, there's no better place to start your next chapter.

residential.headline: A period stunner with a contemporary revamp
residential.description:
The big picture.
Like a perfect pairing of sweet and savoury, this immaculately renovated family residence from the 1930s seamlessly blends stunning period features with contemporary living areas. Outside, a north-facing entertaining area with a solar-heated in-ground pool and private garden is ideal for drinks with guests on summer nights. Yes please.
The little details.
This expansive home makes a grand first impression with a circular driveway, elegant water feature and magnificent façade. In addition to the four bedrooms and the light-filled open plan living and dining area, a private study and a sitting room provide tranquil hideaways for quiet afternoons.
The extras.
The tightly-held Urquhart Estate sits in a peaceful enclave offering a wide variety of dining, and boutique shopping with Glenferrie Road and Auburn Village just around the corner. Scotch College, MLC and Auburn Primary only a moment away. And for weekends of sun, fun and relaxation Fritsch Holzer Park is less than 1km away.

residential.headline: Pristine vintage clinker
residential.description:
The big picture.
In the so-very-popular suburb of Balwyn, this refurbished unit is light and contemporary, while maintaining its original 70s character. Quietly tucked away at the rear, and one of only four, it's perfect for a small family home, an investment property, or a chic downsizer. This little gem is well-positioned on a prestigious street and is close to an array of restaurants, cafés and shops.
The little details.
This fresh spin on a vintage two-bedroom boasts generous light throughout, with large windows opening to a leafy outlook. A voguish take on dining and living spaces creates ample room for entertaining, and retro blues in bathroom add a touch of whimsy to this elegant home.
The extras.
Close to the Whitehorse Road shops and Fintona Girls School, the home's desirable location and retro aesthetic make it a throwback to simple, high-quality suburban living.

residential.headline: A classic beauty with a youthful heart
residential.description:
The big picture.
This regal beauty has stayed away from the limelight up until now. A Victorian inspired Edwardian home built in 1903, it hasn't been offered on the market in 24 years. Expansive in size (616sqm in fact) but cosy in feel, the home's recent renovations have seen the inclusion of a conservatory, study and pool. Pass me that Manhattan won't you?
The little details.
Now, we don't use the term 'magnificent' lightly, but period features including towering ceilings, leadlight windows, detailed brass door accessories, and Baltic pine floors make an incredible first impression. And the crowning jewel? An open plan kitchen, living area and dining room conservatory where you can savour your morning poached eggs while basking in the sun or as the rain patters gently on the glass ceiling.
The extras.
Yes, it's exclusive. Tucked away on one of the most tightly held cul-de-sacs in a close-knit part of Camberwell, 26 Moorhouse Street brims with leafy charm, typical of the area. If you tire of the serenity, Camberwell Junction is just a ten-minute walk away – so you can dine, shop and enjoy the latest blockbusters to your heart's content.
• North West orientation • Front driveway + front and back off street parking • Excellent access to shops, schools and public transport • Five minutes walk from East Camberwell station • Master bedroom with en suite and walk in robe • Additional bedrooms with built in storage

residential.headline: A leafy stunner with contemporary style
residential.description:
The big picture.
Say hello to a natural beauty with a fresh new look. This luxurious, generously sized 5 bedroom home was completely refurbished by Tracy Bufe only 12 months ago, and features expansive living and dining areas that open to a private hedged garden with large terraces sitting on approx 1,106sqm. Garden party anyone?
The little details.
If a quiet cuppa with a book is more your style, a study overlooking the garden, a formal sitting room opening to a balcony, and a living room with a Jetmaster fireplace are all perfect places to get cosy. And for your inner Michelin star chef, a state-of-the-art kitchen allows you to craft amazing culinary delights. Bon appétit!
The extras.
Leaves. Plants. Gardens. Parks. You'd be hard pressed to find a more verdant address than 9 Ferncroft Avenue. Standing on a tree-lined street, and with Hedgely Dene Garden only two doors down, this beautiful home is surrounded front and back by lawns and gardens. Oh, and don't forget it's only a short stroll to Darling Station, Wattletree Road and Central Park too.
• Large entrance hall with limed oak floors • Miele appliances • Soft-closing cabinetry • Stone benches • Master bedroom with designer en suite and walk-in robe • Additional bedrooms with built-in robes • Basement storage or cellar • Double garage • Designer lighting • Italian tiles • Powder room

residential.headline: A Rare Jewel in the Treetops
residential.description:
The big picture.
Home should feel like your own slice of paradise, and this spectacular residence is simply heavenly. Positioned on one of the highest hills in Kew, this contemporary tri-level home opens to breath taking views from all levels. With stunning architecture and two separate garden areas, one featuring a pool, this is your secret oasis of calm in the tightly held Studley Park enclave opposite Yarra Bend Park
The little details.
On the lower level a private sauna is the perfect place to unwind. Two open deck areas, a verandah overlooking the pool, open plan kitchen, dining, living and family rooms with floor-to-ceiling windows allow you to enjoy dinner watching the setting sun. And don't forget the little touches that elevate your daily life – the abundant native birds, blooming gardenias and the views over the Yarra River – all this just a few minutes' drive to the CBD.
The extras.
If two magnificent garden areas are not enough, it's only a short stroll to the Yarra River trails, boat houses and Collingwood Children's farm. A spot of golf perhaps? Yarra Bend has the largest remaining area of native bushland in inner Melbourne and some of Melbourne's leading schools are nearby. It's proximity to EastLink, public transport, Kew Junction and Willsmere village are an added bonus.
• Master bedroom with walk-in robe and en suite • Stainless Steel kitchen • Powder room • Concealed laundry • Solar pool heating with remote control lighting • Two double auto garages • Ducted heating, cooling and vacuum • In Built alarm system • Polished Tasmanian Myrtle floorboards • Huge well fitted study • 1,034 sqm block • 2nd lounge area on lower level • Independent guest wing • Sensor lighting

residential.headline: A double fronted Victorian charm
residential.description:
The big picture.
An 1888 double fronted Victorian residence showcasing light, space and gorgeous garden views with an expansive open-plan family room (OFP), dining and family-sized kitchen featuring a unique wall of glazing, achieving a conservatory-style ambiance.
The little details.
A neat home with period charm perfect for relaxed entertaining today, while still offering endless renovating opportunity for tomorrow (STCA). Comprising of 4 double bedrooms, 3 open fireplaces and a pair of French doors leading to a perfectly manicured garden.
The extras.
Boasting a double carport with rear lane-way access. You're within close proximity to the train, tram or TAFE, and only moments away from an exciting array of retail and dining experiences.
In conjunction with advisory service BuyerX - Tim Picken

residential.headline: A stunning entertainer with room for all
residential.description:
The big picture.
We hope you have the good china ready, because this is a home that's all about gatherings. This expansive two-storey residence with a free-flowing floorplan has all the space to accommodate. A lounge with an open fireplace is ideal for winter warmers, while an enormous family room that opens to a private, north facing landscaped garden is perfect for indoor-outdoor get-togethers.
The little details.
Chefs and bakers prepare to be delighted by the gourmet kitchen with stainless steel benches and ample storage space. A fourth bedroom can be converted into a study, and both the master bedroom with full en suite and the two double bedrooms offer plenty of space. But the final treat? A luxurious outdoor heated plunge pool.
The extras.
Now this is an address that truly lives up to its A-grade position. Located in a highly sought-after pocket of Hawthorn East right in the heart of the Anderson Park precinct. Bonfield Avenue runs parallel to Burke Road, where it's only a few tram stops to Camberwell Junction. The many delights of Auburn Village are also only a short stroll away. What more could you want?
• Heated plunge pool • Formal and informal living areas • Double lock up garage • Bedrooms with built in wardrobes • Brush box floors • Ducted heating • Air conditioning • Security alarm system • Private high fence

residential.headline: A Victorian beauty with endless luxuries
residential.description:
The big picture.
Where do we start? Situated in Hawthorn's enviable St James Park Estate there's just so much to say about this beautiful home. Set on 892sqm of gardens, this double fronted 1892 Victorian residence blends heritage features with luxurious finishes and appliances. The main open plan living and dining space offers incredible flexibility which opens onto the leafy alfresco area - so we expect garden parties galore come summer.
The little details.
The single-level residence's fifth bedroom can be transformed into a private study, or even a third living area (with its charming fireplace, we recommend the last option). The master bedroom boasts an Italian marble en suite with free-standing bath, a walk-in robe, and a private courtyard – perfect for a tranquil morning meditation or cup of tea.
Prepare your daily feast in a stunning chef's space that features a marble benchtop, European appliances and custom cabinetry (because a beautiful kitchen is always the secret ingredient).
The extras.
How to best pass a Saturday? A walk along the river, or browsing Hawthorn's celebrated boutiques? The Yarra River is just a minute away and Hawthorn Station is only a stroll from home (did someone say brunch?). St James Park is just a six-minute walk from your front door - perfect for a picnic or a run with the dog.
• Approximately 892sqm of land • Tessellated return verandah • Lawns in addition to paved area • Hydronic heating • Reverse cycle heating and cooling • Underground cellar with 1000 bottle capacity • Studio that can be made into a gym • Double glazing • Acoustic fence • Attic storage • Solar panels • Auto-irrigation system • Outdoor sound system • Outdoor lighting system • Cubby house • Intercom and alarm • Secure outdoor storage area • Tandem off-street parking

residential.headline: Space and seclusion in the perfect locale
residential.description:
The big picture.
A brand-new town residence combining a cutting-edge approach to design and space with the pleasure of an incredible open plan living and dining area, 4 generous sized bedrooms, 3 bathrooms and double garage all especially designed to reflect timeless elegance.
The little details.
Sitting in an incredible location with just the perfect orientation; in a boutique block of only four homes; residence 2 has the perfect orientation with the north-facing rear ideal for indoor and outdoor entertaining.
The extras.
This highly desirable town residence is conveniently located only moments to Hartwell and Wilson stations; within proximity to Hartwell Primary and Camberwell High School, local shopping and Lynden Park Oval.
• Brand new contemporary residence • Boutique block of only four • Bosch kitchen with stone benches • Private leafy north-facing rear garden with paved terrace

residential.headline: A gorgeous single-leveller nestled in greenery
residential.description:
The big picture.
Light, bright and beautiful: this home is a true stunner. From the moment you walk through the front gates, the residence is warm and welcoming. Spacious floorplans allow you to spread out, while large windows in bedrooms and glass doors in the living room keep everything bathed in sunlight. But the best part? A wraparound courtyard perfect for summer parties. Throw open those doors!
The little details.
Fancy a cup of tea? Because the expansive landscaped gardens at both the front and the back of the house are made for a daily wind down in nature. The winding red brick pathway that connects these areas echoes the painted white brick of the residence itself, and a north-west-facing orientation maximises on light. Well, we did say it's a beauty.
The extras.
Get ready to feast on the east. While 3 Shaftesbury Avenue already stands in a verdant enclave, it's also only a stroll down the road from the Malvern Public Gardens. The residence is just a short walk from the abundance of boutiques, cafés and restaurants, as well as the tram lines, of Malvern Road and High Street. Tooronga Station is also less than 1km away.
• A-grade position • 2 car garage • Solid brick • Single level throughout • One of only two residences

residential.headline: An exceptional classic, located in the heart of Kew
residential.description:
The big picture.
Showcasing federation period features throughout, this 1990’s architecturally built charmer truly captures the essence of yesteryear. Located in the heart of Kew, this family residence boasts a free-flowing, sun drenched floorplan consisting of spacious north-facing dining and sitting rooms. The open plan kitchen and meals area leads out to the gorgeous bluestone paved courtyard, perfect for alfresco entertaining.
The little details.
Quality parquetry hardwood floors, hydronic heating and evaporative cooling throughout. Every bedroom has the added comfort of either a walk-in or built-in robe. Upstairs, a kitchenette and wide balcony offer the ideal spot to relax all year round. A final touch; a spacious two car garage and well thought out workshop area.
The extras.
Close to the Junction and Glenferrie Road boutiques, cafes and restaurants, transport and within walking distance to some of Melbourne's finest schools; Trinity, Ruyton, MLC, Carey, also Swinburne university and magnificent parklands - where convenience will become a way of living.
• 526sqm approx. of land • Security alarm • West facing rear garden • Master bedroom with walk-in robe and ensuite • Quality hardwood cabinetry throughout • Two open fireplaces • Hydronic heating • Evaporative cooling

residential.headline: A light-hearted beauty with room to relax
residential.description:
The big picture.
They say luxury is timeless, don't they? This Edwardian stunner is filled with touches of opulence. Covering approximately 615sqm, the grounds include manicured gardens, lawns and a timber terrace (with a built-in barbecue, and, yes, a spa!) perfect for outdoor entertaining. Or, if it's a little chilly, blast that gas coal-fire in the spacious open plan living, dining, kitchen and family room. Toasty.
The little details.
Kick-off your shoes and spread out. In addition to the main living and kitchen area, a ground floor sitting room and study and an upstairs living room provide the perfect retreat for a cup of tea. High ceilings and Baltic Pine floors are reminiscent of the period, and stone benches, a walk-in pantry and Smeg appliances enhance the impressive chef's kitchen. How divine.
The extras.
It doesn't get more 'leafy Camberwell' than a park at the end of your street: Highfield Park is visible from the front entrance. Riversdale Road runs behind this green space, taking you to Riversdale Station and Camberwell Junction in just a few tram stops. And with Wattle Park just over 1km away, you'll never have an excuse not to get outdoors. Although, we know it's hard to leave the spa.
• North-facing living area with bi-fold doors to terrace • Master bedroom with ensuite and walk-in robe • Two powder rooms • Two further bedrooms with built-in robes • Hydronic heating • Reverse cycle air conditioning • Alarm • Video intercom • Solar panels • 5000-litre rainwater tank and drip irrigation system • Wine cupboard • Auto-gates and internally accessed double garage

residential.headline: A Victorian stunner of newly-renovated splendour
residential.description:
The big picture.
The perfect blend of heritage charm and modern luxury! Set on a deep block, this single fronted, two-storey Victorian residence offers a lovely façade framed by a traditional laced verandah and complemented by a delightful, leafy front garden. Step inside the arched hallway to be greeted by an abundance of beautiful period features including soaring ceilings with roses, cornices and original fireplaces in the two downstairs bedrooms.
Beyond the hallway, a wow-factor transformation awaits with an expansive kitchen, dining and living space of contemporary design and high quality. This sensational, light-filled area is the heart of the home, opening to a huge paved courtyard complete with established gardens and a built-in gas barbecue. It's the ideal sanctuary for gatherings of any size with family and friends. A stunning family bathroom, concealed laundry and heated drying cabinet complete the ground floor.
A new timber staircase leads to two further bedrooms, both large, including the master with ensuite and walk-in robe.
The little details.
The superbly appointed designer kitchen will delight both the home cook and the gourmet chef alike! It showcases a huge stone island benchtop, a massive carrara marble splashback feature wall, sleek cabinetry with an integrated fridge, Miele appliances, (including double ovens and five-zone induction cooktop) and a butler's pantry with an oversized wood feature door.
The adjacent living space has a bank of tall sliding doors and a stunning custom fireplace, perfect for cosy winter nights. Other features include zoned heating and cooling, wide European oak floorboards, premium wool carpets and built-in robes in all bedrooms, an abundance of storage space, ceiling speakers and remote control off-street parking.
The extras.
A quiet, leafy street surrounded by the best of Camberwell – how does that sound? Camberwell Junction, with its array of shops, cafes, restaurants, supermarkets, the famed fresh food market and the historic Rivioli cinema, is literally a few minutes' walk away.
Family-friendly parks are also close-by, including Riversdale Park and Camberwell Sports Ground. Fantastic public transport options with tram stops at both ends of the street and Camberwell rail station within walking distance.
Zoned for Camberwell Primary, Camberwell High and Canterbury Girls' schools and easy access to an array of private schools.

residential.headline: Exquisite grandeur with poolside prestige
residential.description:
The big picture.
If big is beautiful, then this residence is most certainly a Botticelli Angel. A stately French Provincial on the outside and a cutting-edge fashion statement on the inside, the biggest question on everyone's lips will be "What shall I do today?" Maybe a dip in the shimmering pool or watching a movie in the basement theatre? How about enjoying a city sunset view atop Anderson Park or just strolling down the street to dine at Camberwell Junction?
The finer details.
With expansive living zones on all three levels, everyone in the family can choose their own lifestyle adventure. Plantation shutters, soaring ceilings and European Oak floors are a luxurious backdrop, harmonising with the full compliment of Miele appliances in the kitchen and second kitchen. Luxuriate in the hotel quality of every bathroom, featuring the finery of Villeroy and Boch, Grohe and floor-to-ceiling marble.
The extras.
Surrounded by the magical allure of tree-lined avenues, your family will adore wandering along them to renowned schools such as Auburn South Primary, Auburn High, Bialik College, Scotch College and St Kevin's College. Working in the city is a breeze with nearby trams and trains to get you there on time, but on the weekends just jump on the freeway and drive down to the Mornington Peninsula for some sun, sand, wine and relaxation.
• Exceptional five bedroom, five bathroom floorplan • Five distinct and absolutely breathtaking living zones • A huge master bedroom with walk-in robe and free-standing tub ensuite • A convenient ground floor guest suite • Under-cover alfresco overlooking a deep azure pool with water wall • Basement cellar, bar and powder room • Three car auto garage with auto gate • Central heating/air-conditioning, ducted vacuum and security

residential.headline: Rare Corner Block in Residential Growth Zone
residential.description:
The big picture.
Unique opportunity to acquire two properties on prime corner allotment prime for boutique development (STCA). Currently comprising: Two comfortable single level units, consisting of three bedrooms, two bathrooms, generous living areas and immediately providing rental income while you apply for plans.
The little details.
Located within walking distance to Camberwell Junction shopping precinct, close proximity to prestige schools and a variety of transport options at your doorstep.
The extras.
• A-grade corner position • Corner of Hastings Road and Riversdale Road • Land size 815sqm approximately – 27.43m x 29.72m • Residential Growth Zone 1 (RGZ1) • Potential to receive rental income for two properties while you obtain plans • Ideally suited to a boutique development, suited to a high-end apartments or townhouses (STCA)
Selling in conjunction with Nick Ptak 0413 370 442 – Marshall White

residential.headline: An elevated masterpiece of architectural design
residential.description:
The big picture.
Set on one of the bigger land holdings in the estate, this is a visionary architecture in a uniquely elevated setting. With panorama across the Yarra River tree-tops and out to Kinglake, this luxurious residence melds the finest in design and craftsmanship. Indoor and outdoor spaces weave into one another across multiple levels, from the bedrooms adjoining private courtyards to the multiple living areas opening onto expansive terraces and an atrium.
The little details.
Amateur chefs will adore the open plan dining, lounge and kitchen area, fitted with Miele appliances and stone island benchtop, where they can prepare the locally-sourced treats while admiring the vistas. The master bedroom offers a spacious walk-through robe and marble ensuite with a dual shower (and vanity), while the ground floor living and dining room is enhanced by a gas fireplace.
The extras.
A residence surrounded by greenery. Starting with a reserve at your doorstep, you're only a 1km stroll to the Yarra River and its many parklands. Doubtless, many weekends will be spent enjoying family walks or taking in the views with a glass of Prosecco. Kew Junction is just over 1km down Princess Street, and you're surrounding by some of the finest private schools in Melbourne; Xavier, MLC, Trinity and Scotch just to name a few.
• 488sqm of land approx. • Spotted gum floor boards • NABERS energy 6.5 star rating • Rare, elevated position with views • Refrigerated air conditioning • Solar panels • 3 living areas • Feature stairway • Miele 900mm oven • Heat & Glo gas fireplace on ground level • Park-facing window-wall in master bedroom • Broad landing on upper floor can be used as a study • Secondary bedrooms feature built-in robes • Rumpus/cinema room that opens to north-facing courtyard

residential.headline: A magnificent offering of rare natural charm
residential.description:
The big picture.
From its verdant gardens to its light-filled interiors, this 1930's home is stunning to behold from every angle. A spacious, open plan kitchen and living room that connects to an impeccable dining room all offer a north-facing orientation to maximise on light. The living room also opens to a breathtaking back courtyard, ideal for summer soirées and impromptu get-togethers.
The little details.
Little touches of opulence are scattered throughout the residence in the period features, such as ceiling mouldings and a magnificent fireplace in the dining room. Those looking for a quiet nook to enjoy a cup of herbal brew can escape to the front veranda, which overlooks the manicured front garden bursting with colour all year round.
The extras.
If lush gardens at home aren't quite enough greenery, Surrey Park is just over the road – perfect for morning jogs and Sunday picnics with the family. The adjacent Riversdale Road offers trams to the city and takes you to Camberwell Junction in just over 10 minutes. For easy morning brunches, a number of charming cafés are within a short stroll from the residence.
• Double carport • 1000 bottle wine cellar • Roof storage • Heating and cooling • Tiled private back courtyard with partial coverage • Two fireplaces

residential.headline: Period sophistication meets contemporary luxury
residential.description:
The big picture.
Come on a journey which began a century ago and ends in a modern tropical oasis. With an impressively maintained 1920s façade, this two-storey residence sits in stunning 784m2 grounds. The manicured front garden flows through to a rear outdoor area which includes a pool and spa, pavilion, generous lawn and play space, separate paved barbeque area, lush foliage and our favourite, full-sized palm trees.
The finer details.
The residence itself offers a variety of complementary living spaces. An expansive, open-plan kitchen, dining, living area, flowing directly to the outdoors, is ideal for larger celebrations. Otherwise quiet time can be enjoyed in the generous, light-filled lounge with its high ceilings and open fireplace. The equally generous home office provides a serene workspace overlooking the front garden and benefits from natural light throughout the day. The final downstairs room provides flexibility and has been used variously as a dining room, guest room, playroom, bedroom and now separate TV space as family needs have changed over the years. Upstairs the master suite comprises a generous bedroom overlooking the pool and palm trees, ample built-in robes and an en-suite with free-standing bath. The family bathroom is divided into separate spaces for the shower, WC and basin to facilitate streamlined mornings and services the three additional upstairs bedrooms leading off the central landing, each with a walk-in robe.
The extras.
We don't think we could have chosen a more fitting address for this luxurious home. Standing on a grand, leafy street quintessential to this pocket of Hawthorn East, the residence lies halfway between Toorak Road and Camberwell Junction – you can enjoy Saturday shopping trips, Sunday brunch or films at the Rivoli before strolling home. Anderson Park and Burke Road trams are also just moments away.
• North-facing with deciduous summer shade • Shade awnings to upstairs bedroom windows • Original stained glass features • Stained and polished original timber floors • Downstairs cloakroom and shower • Gas ducted heating downstairs with evaporative cooling in the kitchen/dining/living area • Reverse cycle heating/cooling to upstairs rooms • Walk-in pantry with recycling chute • Laundry with drying racks and direct access to outdoor utility area • 3.9Kw Solar power • Fenced solar and/or gas heated saltwater pool and spa with waterfall and slide • Cubby house • Water tank

residential.headline: Grand dame offering enviable modern lifestyle
residential.description:
The big picture.
With its magnificent heritage facade and impressive street presence, this iconic 1889 Victorian terrace "Collingwood" is one of Clifton Hill's finest homes and a rare offering. Soaring ceilings and other glorious period features balance brilliantly with a modern rear transformation. Light, space and a perfect layout for the growing family.
The little details.
Entertain in style in the elegant formal rooms, resplendent with original fireplaces. Relax in the open-plan family domain with its marble kitchen and living room boasting a striking glass ceiling. Throw open the back doors to an inviting deck and deep garden for summertime gatherings. Or just enjoy some quiet downtime in the charming side courtyard. With so many options, you're living the dream!
The extras.
Unrivalled for convenience and lifestyle. How's this list? St Johns and Clifton Hill Primary schools, trams and trains, Eastern Freeway access, Darling Gardens, Fitzroy Pool and Collingwood Leisure Centre - ALL a stone's throw away. Plus, the shops, café culture and local village atmosphere of nearby Queen's Parade.

residential.headline: All the hallmarks of contemporary luxury
residential.description:
** Please register your interest in the enquiry field below so we can keep you informed if the property is to be sold before the next inspection.
The big picture.
This grand residence is a work of art. Designed by award-winning architects JCB, this stunning, 743sqm, two-storey home is crafted entirely from toxin-free materials. Plus, there's breathtaking, north-facing, seasonal gardens and the views over the Yarra River valley. Oh, and did you see the pool?
The finer details.
The verdant beauty extends inside with the natural, custom and handmade finishes throughout - including handblown glass light fittings. The open plan living and dining area beautifully captures impressive views but the best place to enjoy the vistas is from the conservatory leading to the stoned-walled garden room.
The extras.
The residence is located within a tightly-held Studley Park enclave opposite the Yarra Bend Park. This means there are many choices for Saturday picnics using fresh ingredients from the cafés and providores of Kew Junction, which is only a few minutes away. This perfectly situated home is also nearby to many of the city's best schools, as well as Eastlink.
• Approx. 743sqm of land • Mature, seasonal, north-facing gardens • Master bedroom with home cinema, his and her fitted dressing rooms, and heated floors • Italian, aged brass fittings • American Oak joinery • Handmade tiles throughout • Custom-made brass fly screens • Commissioned handblown glass light fittings • Concrete benchtops hand poured on site • Natural paint • Triple filtered water system • Natural timbers • Artisan-crafted wrought-iron balustrades • Australian bluestone balcony • Pergola crafted from single reclaimed timber beams • Aga cast iron cooker • Integrated refrigerator • Italian porcelain sink with insinkerator • Coffee bar • Fruit trees in garden • Ground floor fourth bedroom or study • Fitted laundry • Triple remote garage • Sensor lighting • Automated irrigation • Integrated lighting • Pure alpaca wool carpets • Integrated sound system • Zoned reverse-cycle heating and air conditioning • Saltwater, heated swimming pool • Video intercom

residential.headline: **Contact the agent to arrange a private inspection
residential.description:
The big picture.
Who says a family home can't take your breath away? This 704sqm, two-storey residence blends space and comfort with beautifully appointed design. A split-level, open plan kitchen, living and dining room with a gas fireplace connects to an expansive outdoor deck with built-in barbecue, so you can entertain guests all year round. And adjoining this – a double-sized indoor spa!
The finer details.
This stunning home is complemented by manicured front and back gardens with mature trees and a waterfall feature. The master and adjacent bedrooms, and connecting balcony, offer impressive views out to the CBD, and a sixth bedroom or study. Stained glass windows from the original 1920s build and feature lighting throughout add to the sense of opulence.
The extras.
Here is an address worthy of the residence. Tucked away in a quiet, verdant pocket of Hawthorn East, 4 Nicholson Street enjoys peaceful surroundings just 1km from Camberwell Junction. Sir William Angliss Reserve is also just 600m up the road, while Fritsch Holzer Park is a 1km stroll from home. And there are many of the city's best schools nearby.
• Large lawn in back gardens • Split-level deck with in-built barbecue • Downstairs basement storage (under decking) • Indoor double-sized spa room with television capabilities and en suite • Floor to ceiling windows and glass doors leading to deck in living and spa room • Separate second dining room • Front sitting room • Large island bench in kitchen • Ample kitchen storage • Ilve appliances & Miele dishwasher • QASAIR rangehood • Master bedroom with walk-in robe and en suite • Secondary bedrooms with built-in robes • Front porch overlooking garden • Air conditioning • Enclosed clothesline with extra storage space • 2 car spaces with hidden storage in carport roof

residential.headline: Potential to build your dream home
residential.description:
The big picture.
This expansive family residence is the embodiment of the word 'charming'. Whether you are spreading out in the spacious and sunlight-drenched living and dining room, or cooking up a storm in the refurbished kitchen, you're sure to savour life's every moment in this cosy home. Plus, there's the generous backyard just made for garden get-togethers.
The finer details.
You'll soon find that this home is full of little surprises. First, it comes with a permit for two townhouses side by side (subject to council approval) – for those looking to boost the long-term investment appeal. Then there's also the separate workshop space, for any artists wanting a private studio to practise their craft.
The extras.
City convenience - meet natural beauty. Situated on approx. 651sqm in a quiet, leafy pocket of Doncaster East, the residence is only a few minutes' walk from Tunstall Square. Families with kids can pop around the corner to the playground of Aintree Reserve, and just 1.5km to the north, Cat Jump Park offers a picturesque green space that's perfect for morning jogs or afternoon footy games.
• Polished floorboards in the kitchen • Main bed with en suite and built-in robes • Gas ducted heating and split system air conditioning • Secure double carport • Covered store & workshop • Water tank • General residential zone – schedule 1 • Easy access to buses, the Eastern Freeway and Westfield • Near to Donburn Primary School and East Doncaster Secondary College

residential.headline: **Please register to attend an inspection
residential.description:
The big picture.
Nature is the word when it comes to this stunning town residence. Designed by Kavellaris Urban Design (KUB - Architecture), this luxurious residence is defined by the natural stone and timber that form the exterior and weave through the interior. Add a verdant courtyard that connects to a spacious open plan living, dining and kitchen area, and this home feels positively tranquil.
The finer details.
It's not often we come across a town residence such as this. Once you ascend the magnificent timber staircase, a rumpus room makes a perfect kids' play area or additional sitting room. Both upstairs bedrooms come with private en suites, while the master bedroom features mirrored highlights that contrast boldly with the subtle grain of the timber built-in robes and stand-alone headboard.
The extras.
Situated right in the heart of the Harcourt Estate with all the facilities at your doorstep. Surrounded by some of the finest schools Melbourne has to offer, with Carey Grammar, MLC and Ruyton Girls' School within a walking distance just to name a few. Additionally you're only a short stroll to Burke or Glenferrie Road shops, cafes, restaurants and transport.
• Generous proportions • Stone benchtop in kitchen • Miele & ILVE appliances • Remote double garage • Secure entry • Ducted heating and cooling throughout

residential.headline: **Contact the agent to arrange a private inspection
residential.description:
The big picture.
Set on 536sqm of land, this two-storey, north-facing residence is stately in its size, quality, and design. An open plan kitchen, dining and living area connects to a sprawling back lawn through floor-to-ceiling windows and glass doors, creating the perfect indoor-outdoor entertainment setting. Plus, a manicured front garden makes quite the entrance.
The finer details.
Dinner party lovers, rejoice. A secondary dining room framed by two entrance columns and a striking feature window is ideal for feasts of all kinds. Families can enjoy evenings in the additional living room, sipping on hot drinks around the fireplace. For moments of peaceful solitude, a private study can be converted into a fifth bedroom, rumpus room or library, depending on your needs.
The extras.
Local cafés? Stunning gardens? Esteemed schools? Easy transport? Check, check, check, and check. Located in the Sackville Ward precinct, as well as the highly sought-after private school belt, the home is only a stroll to Glenferrie, Cotham and Barkers Roads. Kellett Reserve is less than a minute from your doorstep, as is the charming café Kupid Espresso – for your morning coffee fix.
• Land 536sqm approx. • Solid home • 2 single car garages • Generous sized rooms throughout • First time on the market in 18 years

residential.headline: Unparalleled Family Luxury on Scotch Hill - (Inspections by Appointment)
residential.description:
The big picture.
Gracing beautiful landscaped gardens lined with heightening trees this new contemporary residence of impressive proportions over 3-levels, is bathed with an abundance of natural light from expansive windows and floor-to-ceiling glass walls; constructed with a commitment to quality and brilliantly located in the Scotch Hill precinct.
The finer details.
The quiet, gallery-like interior features a striking white and grey themed décor, high ceilings and herringbone parquetry flooring flowing through the entrance foyer to a downstairs bedroom with WIR/ensuite, sitting room, wine room and powder room. Through to a stunning open-plan informal living domain incorporating a state-of-the art prestige Gaggenau/marble kitchen with a butler's pantry and laundry. All opening to an outdoor alfresco entertaining area with pool and gas mains barbeque kitchen – perfect for year round indoor/outdoor entertaining.
The extras.
The upstairs area has a huge retreat and four further bedrooms, three with ensuites plus a family bathroom – a sumptuous master includes a dressing room and balcony. Leading through a remote Gorter roof hatch to a 3rd level, rooftop entertaining area complete with a 2nd gas mains barbeque kitchen and City skyline glimpses.
In conjunction with Nick Ptak - 0413 370 442

residential.headline: **Contact the agent to arrange a private inspection
residential.description:
Top-level charm with views all around
The big picture.
We believe the leafy streets of Kew are best viewed from the treetops. With dual-entry, positioned in a lovely leafy heritage style street close to Glenferrie Road this first-floor, fully refurbished 1940s apartment offers all the comforts of a house (including the rare absence of shared walls), with views over a gorgeous garden setting from the living room and covered balcony. Generously sized rooms and an open plan kitchen and living area also enhance the sense of spaciousness.
The finer details.
Ideal for entertaining friends and family on sunny afternoons & during the colder months, a working open fireplace in the living room makes for perfect get-togethers over hot drinks and classic movies.
The extras.
Standing near the border of Kew and Hawthorn, this home enjoys the best of both worlds: a blue-chip address in the private school precinct of Kew, with the transport, dining and shopping of Glenferrie Road and Hawthorn moments away, and only a 1km stroll to the beautiful Alexandra Gardens.
• Two separate entrances • North-facing kitchen and living space • Polished hardwood floors • Bedrooms with built-in robes • Reverse cycle heating and cooling throughout • Insulation throughout that adds to soundproofing

residential.headline: Prime position in one of the most exclusive streets
residential.description:
The big picture.
Sitting on 786sqm approx in one of the most exclusive streets in Hawthorn East looking out onto Anderson Park, this neat casual home is perfect for relaxed entertaining today, while still offering endless renovating or re-building opportunities for tomorrow (subject to council approval of course).
The finer details.
• 5 bedrooms • 3 bathrooms • 786sqm approx of land • Renovate or re-build (STCA) • North facing rear

residential.headline: A natural beauty in the heart of the inner east
residential.description:
The big picture.
It's not often that an apartment can evoke such a natural scene, but this Hawthorn East home is awash in the greenery that the suburb is famed for. Climbing planters cover the building's exterior, while treetops can be viewed through every window. But it's the expansive, north-facing balcony that offers a true verdant oasis, as copious planters line the walls and spill from the roof. Just in time for a spring party?
The finer details.
Before you say anything, don't worry – the interiors are just as impressive. Thanks to the residence's orientation, the open plan kitchen, dining and lounge area receives abundant natural light throughout the day. Every bedroom offers built-in robes, while the master also joins with a private en suite. The appealing internal size is 110sqm and 41sqm of outdoor entertainment space. Finally, a colour scheme of white, timber and charcoal offers a striking contrast to the greenery throughout.
The extras.
The tale of natural beauty doesn't end there, as this home gains its namesake from the beloved Anderson Park, just moments down the road. Heading 100m east, Burke Road offers cafés, restaurants, boutiques and trams to the CBD. It's also only a little over 1km to Camberwell Junction – so it's easy to stroll home after a Saturday night cinema outing or a meal at a local favourite.
• Lounge connects to balcony through glass doors, ideal for indoor-outdoor entertainment • Clever storage throughout • Large island benchtop in kitchen • Freestanding bath • Split system air conditioning • Boutique apartment building

residential.headline: Countryside splendour meets Melbourne's inner east on 1664sqm land
residential.description:
The big picture.
Have you ever dreamed of a country home, but with an inner-city address? Because this grand, red brick residence certainly looks the part, especially considering it sits on an impressive 1664sqm of lawn, paved courtyard and gardens. Inside, 14ft ceilings and generously sized rooms add to the sense of space and splendour. And speaking of space, two separate living rooms provide a wealth of areas for entertaining or relaxing.
The finer details.
This stunning residence offers not one, not two, but three working period fireplaces in the two living spaces and one bedroom respectively – so put on the kettle and get cosy. An ornate front veranda is perfect for a quiet glass of wine on warm evenings, while the back courtyard is ideal for larger al fresco gatherings. Finally, a permit to subdivide and possible reconstruction caters to those with a creative vision for this incredible site.
The extras.
Those looking to stretch their legs beyond the residence's expansive grounds will be delighted to discover parklands and reserves just off either end of the street. And while you may be surrounded by nature, this home still offers Melbourne's inner east at your fingertips. Palace Balwyn Cinema and the cafés, shopping and trams of Whitehorse Road are less than 1km away and Burke Road is just three minutes' drive from home.
• Bluestone foundation home • Fourth bedroom can be converted into study • Gardens with fully-grown deciduous and non-deciduous trees • Kitchen with walk-in pantry • Large double garage and workshop at rear of property • Carport and extensive parking space in driveway • Separate laundry • Two bedrooms with built-in robes • Freestanding bath • Air conditioning in several rooms • Permit to subdivide with possible permit to demolish • 14ft ceilings keep residence naturally cool in summer

residential.headline: A rare opportunity on 920 sqm approx.
residential.description:
The big picture.
Right in the heart of the Anderson Park Precinct, this gem is situated on an expansive block of 920 sqm approx. and boasting a wide frontage of 18.3m approx. Perfect opportunity to build your very own new luxury family residence (STCA).
The finer details.
• 5 bedrooms • 3 bathrooms • 920sqm approx. of land • 18.3m frontage • Renovate or re-build (STCA)

residential.headline: A charismatic Californian only seconds from Kew's elite private schools
residential.description:
** Please register your interest in the enquiry field below so we can keep you informed if the property is to be sold before the next inspection.
The big picture.
There's no denying it –this pretty family home sits in an extraordinarily desirable position. Stroll just a few metres in any direction to find yourself at the gates of Melbourne's top-tier schools including Trinity, Ruyton, Xavier and Methodist Ladies College. A beautiful Californian Bungalow that has been stylishly renovated, the surrounding landscaped garden and alfresco areas provide a serene oasis in contrast to the nearby hustle and bustle.
The finer details.
Beyond the romantic front verandah, step into an environment where endearing leadlight, deep picture rails, ornate ceiling roses and wall panelling harmonise with a contemporary extension. If you were born to entertain, then you'll absolutely adore the easy flow from the spacious formal rooms to the casual family room, sweeping out via b-folds to a vine-laden alfresco and a privately hedged garden with a sun-deck.
The extras.
After school and work, why not simply wander around the corner to either Glenferrie Road or Kew Junction – both locations renowned for their dynamic dining culture, quality providores and cutting-edge retail. If the city is where you need to go, then walk with ease to the train or tram. Stop along the way to enjoy the beauty of the Yarra River, vibrant Victoria Gardens Shopping Centre and exciting inner-city eateries.
• An ideal four bedroom, two bathroom design • Dedicated two-seat home office with rear alfresco entry • Built-in desks located in two of the bedrooms and the open-plan living • Modern stone kitchen with premium appliances • Stylishly renovated bathrooms • Electric fireplaces in the lounge room and dining room • Ducted heating and a split system air-conditioner • Double auto garage and ample off-street parking

residential.headline: A Stephen Akehurst unique masterpiece in the Harcourt Estate
residential.description:
The big picture.
Well, we're officially awestruck. Inspired by the sophisticated yet rustic, beach-style architecture of The Hamptons, this three-storey home from award-winning Stephen Akehurst offers luxury design on another level. We especially love the two separate courtyards with manicured gardens: a smaller one ideal for peaceful morning coffees, and a larger one perfect for al fresco dinner parties.
The finer details.
With an open plan kitchen (yes, it's marble and Miele), dining and living area featuring a gas fireplace, this magnificent home is also made for indoor gatherings. The first level offers stunning views over the CBD where a rumpus room provides a play space or additional sitting room. On the top floor, a private study can be converted into a fifth bedroom or home gym.
The extras.
Who doesn't want to live in the exclusive Harcourt Estate? Enjoying a cul-de-sac address, the residence lies mere moments from the eateries and boutiques along Auburn Village, Glenferrie, and Burke Road. Conveniently located only a short walk to Sir William Angliss Reserve, as well as Auburn Station. And for families with kids, this stately home is surrounded by the finest private school belt in Victoria with Carey right across the road; additionally, MLC, Ruyton, Xavier and Trinity Grammar School all within a walking distance.
• Marble kitchen • Miele appliances • Master bedroom with access to private courtyard • Three additional bedrooms with built-in robes • Two paved al fresco courtyards with high-walled landscaped gardens • Larger courtyard features a pergola • 7-star energy rating • Double glazing • Subfloor hydronic heating

residential.headline: Sold Off Market
residential.description: Incredibly renovated this immaculately presented unit offers the convenience of the ideal location with Mont Albert Road shops, parkland and transport just moments away.

residential.headline: Single level privacy just seconds from Camberwell Junction
residential.description:
The big picture.
If your dream is to spend your leisure time dining out with friends, exercising or hitting the shops, then this stylish, secure and low-maintenance residence is for you. Just around the corner from Camberwell Junction, and a short tram ride into the Glenferrie Road strip, your children will be able to either walk or catch public transport to Melbourne's finest schools.
The finer details.
A perfectly peaceful design tucked privately behind auto gates, choose to entertain beside the fireplace in the lounge, in the elegant dining room, or beyond where the meals and family room are filled with sunlight. Every generation will gather alongside the stone island in the premium kitchen or out past the bi-folds where a sunny alfresco is joined by low-maintenance turf.
The extras.
Hidden away yet so wonderfully close to the hustle and bustle of nearby trams, train, acclaimed restaurants, high-end retailers, fresh food market and specialty shops, stroll to the Rivoli Cinema, Fritsch Holzer Park and Auburn South Primary School. Close to Auburn High, Bialik College, Scotch College, Strathcona, Sienna College and every other elite school in the area, you'll never need to use the car again.
• A quiet study • Master bedroom with walk-in robe and renovated ensuite • Renovated bathroom with floor-to-ceiling tiling • Ducted heating and evaporative cooling • Timber parquet floors throughout • Double auto garage • Attic storage above garage • CCTV

residential.headline: A grand haven with room for all the family
residential.description:
The big picture.
It's not often you find a home that effortlessly balances stately elegance and cosy charm. Situated on 659sqm approx. this single level residence, designed by the residing family, offers endless space and light with ample areas for entertainment. An expansive open plan kitchen and living area that opens on to a paved garden is ideal for soirées of all sizes, and an extra lounge space provides a great room for the kids to play.
The finer details.
An additional grand dining and adjoining sitting room are perfect for dinner parties followed by a digestif. A study can be converted into a fifth bedroom depending on your needs, and a master bedroom, with walk-in robe and en suite, offers outlooks over the manicured front garden.
The extras.
Speaking of balance, the residence enjoys an address within close proximity to all the facilities that you need - with MLC, Ruyton and Trinity Grammar School within 1km. Additionally transport, restaurants and boutiques of Glenferrie Road and High Street are all only a walk away, as is Victoria Park and Alexandra Gardens.
• Built in 1999 by a European builder • Single level • Hydronic heating • Refrigerated cooling • Solid brick • High ceilings throughout • German electronic external shutters • Solid parquetry floors • Granite kitchen • Multiple living zones • Double garage

residential.headline: **Contact the agent to arrange a private inspection
residential.description:
The big picture.
This level three apartment within the aptly named Hallmark offers stunning design, luxurious finishes and more than one big name to its creation. In an unmissable building set against the Ivanhoe backdrop, this home offers a north-facing, open plan kitchen and living space that opens onto an expansive terrace - perfect for cocktails.
The finer details.
We did say luxury finishes; rich materials from metal and bronze accents to natural stone and timber enhance the sense of this being a 'designer' home. A kitchen crafted by the acclaimed Adam D'Sylva showcases Gaggenau appliances, while a study makes working from home easy.
The extras.
A home of this pedigree deserves an address to match. Situated in the heart of this highly sought-after suburb, Hallmark stands on a quiet, leafy street with both Ivanhoe Station and the cafés, restaurants and boutiques of Upper Heidelberg Road less than two minutes' walk away. A wealth of popular parks and reserves are within a 1.5km radius, and many esteemed schools are also close by.
• 112sqm total area • Boutique complex with only 32 high-end residences • Beulah International high-end development • Split system reverse cycle heating and cooling • CCTV/FOB security system • Gaggenau appliances • Secure basement car-parking and basement storage

residential.headline: **Please register to attend an inspection
residential.description:
Architectural brilliance inspired by nature
The big picture.
And we do mean the 'big' picture. Set across 759sqm of land, this stunning home offers stately, modern architecture with an expansive layout. Seamless transition between indoor and the outdoor spaces with a north-facing, open plan kitchen, living and dining area connecting to a paved courtyard (and outdoor fireplace). Plus, there's a spacious back garden and lawn with a eucalyptus tree centerpiece.
The finer details.
Chefs and hosts take note-the kitchen's island bench is a one of a kind. Also joining the courtyard, an additional sitting room with a gas fireplace makes a picturesque nook for cosy winter evenings. The ground floor master bedroom features a walk-in robe and en suite, while two of the first-floor bedrooms connect with a balcony overlooking the treetops of Kew.
The extras.
It doesn't get more desirable, or more 'Melbourne', than living moments from the Yarra River. Just over 500m from home, the banks of the river and adjoining parklands offer idyllic spots for exercise and escapes in nature. Kew Junction is little more than 1km down the road, while the nearby Eastern Freeway allows for day trips to the Yarra Valley. Plus, many of the finest schools in Melbourne including Xavier, Trinity, MLC, Ruyton and Carey Grammar only moments away.
• 759sqm approx. land • Architecturally designed • Double garage • Brilliant indoor/outdoor entertaining • Built-in outdoor fireplace

residential.headline: Lock-up and leave luxury close to Anderson Park
residential.description:
The big picture.
Spend every day enjoying mouth-watering eateries, walking through spectacular Anderson Park or attending elite local schools from this sparkling contemporary residence. A rejuvenating hideaway with three impressive living zones and a versatile three or four bedroom configuration, the high-calibre easy-to-manage design ensures that you can focus on the experiences you adore, rather than attending to the chores at home.
The finer details.
All generations will appreciate the thoughtful separation between the living areas. Rejuvenate in the stylish lounge, enjoy gaming in the retreat and play the perfect host in the vast open dining/family room. Friends will gravitate to the gas log fire, the stone island beside the ILVE/Miele kitchen, or out under the alfresco while people take turns putting on the green. Boasting three stone ensuites, the large study is ideal as a fourth bedroom.
The extras.
Your children will stroll down the street to Auburn South Primary, Auburn High, Bialik College and Scotch College, meaning less time stuck in the car and more time for you. Take a leisurely walk or jump on the tram for a bit of retail therapy, the latest cinema releases and acclaimed cuisine dotted through Camberwell Junction. Surrounded by public transport, you'll only need your car to drive down the M1 Freeway to the Mornington Peninsula.
• Excellent storage including a walk-in pantry and under-stair cellar • Hydronic heating, multiple split system air-conditioners and ducted vacuum • Miele dishwasher and large ILVE oven/cooktop • Stone powder room • Security system • Four-car basement garage with auto gate • Laundry chute • Landscaped low-maintenance gardens with irrigation

The big picture.
This completely transformed two-storey Californian Bungalow blends space and comfort seamlessly as well as ticks all the boxes plus more! You will be welcomed with floor-to-ceiling windows that drench the home with sunlight, fully equipped kitchen with Hafele, Liebherr, Miele and Smeg appliances, living and dining room with a gas fireplace that connects to an expansive outdoor deck with lap pool, so you can entertain guests all year round.

This exquisite home is complemented by an immaculate landscaped front garden and outdoor living area which can be viewed through the master, adjacent bedrooms, and fifth bedroom or study. The fluidity continues with the three separate living areas including a rumpus area with built-in floating shelf, three ensuites and undercover carport and driveway for your cars.
