Situated right in the heart of the Harcourt Estate with all the facilities at your doorstep. Surrounded by some of the finest schools Melbourne has to offer, with Carey Grammar, MLC and Ruyton Girls' School within a walking distance just to name a few. Additionally, you're only a short stroll to Burke or Glenferrie Road shops, cafes, restaurants and transport.
• Double Hafele pull out pantry in the butler's pantry and single in the main kitchen • Liebherr integrated French door fridge in the butler's pantry and single door with freezer drawers in the main kitchen • Miele dishwasher knock2open • Fisher & Paykel drawer dishwasher • Zip tap in the bar with cold & sparkling water • Smeg gas fuel oven/stove • Enclosed microwave in butler's pantry • Reverse cycle cooling and heating • Double brick home • Monitored security system

residential.headline: Exceptional rare offering - first time in 32 years
residential.description:
The big picture.
A gigantic multi-zone entertainer's design, an extensive list of luxuries, and a passionately sought-after position only steps from spectacular Anderson Park make this five bedroom plus study residence an exhilarating real estate 'triple threat'. Without exception, every generation will be able to work, relax or socialise without impacting on the plans or privacy of others. So, the big question is, "Who's throwing the first party?".
The finer details.
On 840 sqm approx. with a lavish renovation maximising city and valley views, four of the five living rooms join to create a magnificently vast space. The impressively dressed stone kitchen and the massive alfresco deck sit alongside, providing the perfect backdrop to friendship, laughter and great memories. Parents can unwind in the private retreat, placed beside the master bedroom with a 'his and hers' dressing room and a full marble ensuite.
The extras.
With lock up parking for three cars and additional space for two more and a boat, leave them behind as your children walk to the playground, Auburn South Primary, Bialik College, Scotch and St Kevin's. Get on your bike and ride along Gardiners Creek Trail into the city, walk to the train, or jump on the tram to savour the many restaurants at Camberwell Junction. If the Australian Open has inspired you, then the tennis club is only 50 metres away.
• On a substantial corner block • Impressive stone kitchen and second/butler's kitchen with second dishwasher • Take your pick from two deluxe master suites • Electric subfloor heating in two of the bathrooms • An executive home office • Serene upstairs sitting area with leafy street views • Gas log fire in the expansive family room • Convenient hobby room/large storage • A fabulous low-maintenance garden • Gorgeous lime-washed broad oak floors • Ducted heating/air-conditioning and ducted vacuum • Double glazing
https:/​/​www.consumer.vic.gov.au/​duediligencechecklist

residential.headline: A Rare Victorian Original
residential.description:
The big picture. This rare Victorian gem is one of the few original homes along Robinson Road. Placed in a coveted Scotch Hill position, this residence is a true renovator's dream (subject to council approval of course).
The little details. Featuring original period details including the beautiful bay windows and iron railings, it's the perfect groundwork for modern touch-ups. Equipped with 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and off-street parking from the rear laneway access, this 674-sqm site is an opportunity not to miss.

residential.headline: Perfectly poised Californian with separate self-contained unit
residential.description:
The big picture.
A beautiful two storey Californian Bungalow full of charm, sophistication and comfort is the perfect sanctuary with convenience. Alongside the spacious backyard that is perfect for entertaining, it features a unique offering which is a completely separate self-contained unit equipped with its own facilities, perfect for the relatives, home office or teenagers retreat.
The finer details.
The main residence welcomes you with an inviting sun filled entry hall that leads to the expansive formal lounge that will be sure to keep you and your family warm with the open fireplace. In addition, you are spoilt with 4 bedrooms, 2 recently renovated bathrooms and kitchen, dining area, ground floor study with peaceful nature views and 2 off-street parking.
The extras.
Located in leafy Camberwell with Riversdale Park, Willison Park and Camberwell Sportsground just minutes away, you'll never have an excuse not to get outdoors. Convenience is at your service with the trams, Riversdale and Willison Station being within 350m.
• Ducted heating and multiple split system air-conditioners • Separate workshop with upstairs loft space • Zoned for Camberwell High and Camberwell Primary School • Separate home office or teenagers retreat • Walk to private schools and village shops

residential.headline: A north-facing charmer where the Yarra is your neighbour
residential.description:
The big picture.
What's the saying? An 'apartment that feels like a home'? That certainly can be said of this charming Hawthorn residence. A north-facing orientation and ample windows ensure that, unlike other apartments, every room is bathed in sunlight throughout the day. A generously sized lounge and living area also offers a sense of space akin to that of a house, while also connecting to an expansive balcony perfect for cocktails among the treetops.
The finer details.
Expanding on the living spaces, it's worth noting that the size and north-facing orientation of the balcony and lounge, unlike some other apartments, make this home ideal for entertaining guests. Emphasis is also given to storage and convenience throughout, with both bedrooms offering built-in robes and a kitchen that includes a dishwasher and plenty of cupboard room. Finally, two secure off-street car spaces enhance the ease of living.
The extras.
We've held off on one key detail when it comes to the appeal of this apartment: the location. It's just a short stroll to the Yarra River, where you can enjoy picnics with the family or a scenic route to the CBD or northern suburbs via bike. Hawthorn Station is less than 1km away, as are the cafés, restaurants and boutiques of Burwood Road. Plus, you also only need tram over the river to sample the many delights of Swan Street and Burnley.

residential.headline: Art Deco styled clinker brick hideaway, across from Carey Grammar
residential.description:
** Please register your interest in the enquiry field below so we can keep you informed if the property is to be sold before the next inspection.
The big picture.
Nestled privately behind a brick wall and surrounded by an array of sun-dappled garden pockets ready to be enjoyed at different times of the day, a pretty clinker brick façade reveals generous dimensions and enormous potential to transform from classic to contemporary. Spread over an impressive 731 sqm approx. block, this double brick home retains its original features including curved walls, stepped cornices and stylised mantelpieces.
The finer details.
Entering via a spacious porch patio, the double brick encased interiors create a serene and cool oasis complemented by an array of north-facing windows that capture natural light throughout the day. A selection of living zones offers the perfect canvas to make your own over time; sunroom with entertainer's deck, formal lounge with gas log fire and garden outlook bay window, elegant dining and large retreat opening to rear courtyard garden.
The extras.
Why drive? There's certainly no need to from this spectacularly central location. A stroll to the train station means fast access into the city while your children can make their way down the street to Carey Grammar, Auburn Primary School, MLC, Ruyton, Trinity and Xavier College. As for dining and retail, enjoy Melbourne's finest with Auburn Village, Glenferrie Road, Kew Junction and Camberwell all within close proximity.
• A bright central kitchen with quality appliances • Two spacious bathrooms • High ceilings and generous dimensions throughout • Beautifully established gardens in a private setting • Multiple alfresco areas • Circular driveway with space for multiple cars plus single garage • On a desirable corner with enormous potential (STCA)

residential.headline: High-side perfection with luxurious designer sparkle
residential.description:
The big picture.
A dream proposition for those who would rather spend weekends playing sport, enjoying new culinary experiences, or completely relaxing down at the beach house, this near-new family residence is a low-maintenance jewel crafted to the highest quality. Spoilt for choice with many first-class schools close by, everyone in the family will fall in love with the lifestyle ease.
The finer details.
Perfectly designed for extroverts and introverts, you can choose whether to host parties beside the banks of glazing that feature in the vast dining/family room or quietly retire to the study or peaceful retreat. Either way, the sundeck will always be calling to you, as will the comprehensively fitted Miele kitchen with stone surfaces, a butler's pantry and desirable wine cellar.
The extras.
The neighbours are absolutely amazing – just ask the vendors. This pretty pocket is tucked away from the hustle and bustle of nearby Burke and Toorak Roads, but obviously enjoys the benefits of being just a short walk to buzzing cafes and the tram for an easy trip to Camberwell Junction and the Rivoli Cinema. Camberwell South Primary, St Cecilia's Primary, Auburn High, Bialik, Scotch and St Kevin's Colleges are all conveniently close by.
• Westerly views across the neighbourhood tree-tops from the master bedroom • Master walk-in robe and dual-vanity stone ensuite • All bathrooms feature floor-to-ceiling tiling • Ground floor study/fifth bedroom • Clever custom storage solutions throughout including an under-stair cellar • Automatic blinds on the ground floor • Automatic security gate to a 1.5 car-wide garage providing great storage • Security system and video intercom • Dual zoned heating and cooling

residential.headline: A spectacular family surprise behind a private frontage
residential.description:
**Please register your interest in the enquiry field below so we can keep you informed if the property is to be sold before the next inspection.
The big picture.
On first glance you'd think this house was single fronted but once you step into the seductively renovated interior you'll discover a massive family residence that fans out across the rear of the block. A cutting-edge entertainer drenched in natural light, luxuriously appointed, and perfectly positioned walking distance to MLC, Ruyton, Trinity and Xavier College, this is the pinnacle of exclusive family living.
